riddles.question: What has an eye but cannot see?
I am always coming, but never arrive. What am I?
What has a neck without a head, a body without legs, and can be found in the sea?
What gets wetter the more it dries?
What has a head and a foot, but no legs?
What has to be filled before you can empty it?
I am light as a feather, but the strongest person can't hold me for five minutes. What am I?
What has cities, but no houses; has mountains, but no trees; and has water, but no fish?
What is full of holes but still holds water?
What has one eye but cannot blink?
What has to be broken before you can use it?
What has a neck without a head, a body without legs, and is always in the water?
What has keys but no locks, space but no room, and you can enter but never leave?
What has an eye but cannot see, a tongue but cannot speak, and a head but cannot think?
What is always coming but never arrives?
What has a mouth but never speaks, and a bed but never sleeps?
What has a neck without a head, a body without legs, and can be worn?
What has leaves, but is not a plant?
What has a bank but no money, and a bed but no sleep?
What has a spine but no bones, and can tell you a story?
What has a head but no brain, and a tongue but cannot taste?
What gets smaller the more you use it?
What has a voice but never speaks, and a bed but never sleeps?
You can hold it in your hand, but you can't own it. What is it?
What has an eye but cannot cry, and a wing but cannot fly?
What is always running but never gets tired?
What has a head and a tail, but no body?
What has keys but cannot open doors, space but no room, and you can enter but never leave?
What has one voice but speaks in many tongues?
What has a neck but no head, a body but no legs, and can be found on a shirt?
What has cities, but no houses; mountains, but no trees; and water, but no fish?
What breaks without a sound?
What has to be passed before it can be used?
What has an eye but cannot see, and a head but cannot think?
What has a neck like a bottle, but a body like a pear?
What gets sharper the more you use it?
What has a beginning, a middle, and an end, but no voice?
What has hands but cannot clap, and a face but cannot smile?
What is always coming closer but never arrives?
What has a neck but no head, a body but no legs, and is always moving?
What has a tongue but cannot taste, and a bed but never sleeps?
What has keys but can't open locks?
What has cities but no houses, forests but no trees, and water but no fish?
What has a head, a foot, and four legs, but cannot walk?
What has keys but opens no doors, space but holds no objects, and enters the mind but has no body?
What tells you the truth but has no voice?
What has one eye but cannot cry, and a web but cannot spin?
What is lighter than a feather, but the strongest person can't hold it for five minutes?
What has an eye but cannot see, a back but cannot turn, and a spine but no bones?
What has a neck without a head, a body without legs, and is found on a bottle?
What has pages but no words, a spine but no bones, and tells a story through pictures?
What gets heavier the more you take away from it?
What has a voice but never speaks, and tells a story without words?
What has to be built before you can climb it?
What has an eye but cries all the time?
What has to be caught before it can be thrown?
What has a neck but no head, a body but no legs, and is always on time?
What has cities but no houses, mountains but no trees, and water but no fish? (Bonus: Different answer)
The more you take, the more you leave behind. What am I?
What has a mouth but never speaks, a bed but never sleeps, and carries many ships?
What has one foot in the future, one foot in the past, and is always moving?
What has many keys but cannot open any doors?
What 8 letter word can have a letter taken away and it still makes a word?
What has a head and a body, but no legs?
What has a neck like a bottle but a body like a bell?
What has an eye but cannot see, a tongue but cannot taste, and a spine but no bones?
You throw away the outside and keep the inside. What is it?
What has a voice but never speaks, and can be heard all over the world?
What has a head, a tail, is brown, and has no legs?
David's father has three sons: Snap, Crackle, and ?
What can travel around the world while staying in a corner?
What gets wetter as it dries?
Can you name three consecutive days without using the words Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, or Sunday?
What has a neck but no head?
What comes once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years?
What has teeth but cannot bite?
What has many keys but can't open a single lock?
What has words but never speaks?
What has one eye but can't see?
What has four eyes but can't see?
Where does Christmas come before Thanksgiving?
What has a thumb and four fingers but is not alive?
What has hands but can't clap?
What has a face and two hands but no arms or legs?
What has 88 keys, but can't even open a single door?
Why is Europe like a frying pan?
options: Because it has Greece at the bottom.
Because it's full of delicious food.
Because it's shaped like a circle.
riddles.answer: Because it has Greece at the bottom.

riddles.question: What We Caught We Threw Away, What We Didn’t Catch We Kept
What room do ghosts avoid?
I make two people out of one. What am I?
What is so fragile that just saying its name breaks it?
What can jump higher than a building?
You live in a one story house made entirely of redwood. What color would the stairs be?
What has six faces, but does not wear makeup, has twenty-one eyes, but cannot see?
Who can shave 25 times a day but still have a beard?
A boy and a doctor were fishing. The boy is the doctor’s son but the doctor is not the boy’s father. Who is the doctor?
I am not alive, but I grow; I don't have lungs, but I need air; I don't have a mouth, but water kills me. What am I?
What is more useful when it is broken?

riddles.riddle: There is a house. A person enters this house blind but exits it seeing. What is it?
What is seen in the middle of March and April that can’t be seen at the beginning or end of either month?

riddles.question: Mr. and Mrs. Mustard have six daughters and each daughter has one brother. How many people are in the Mustard family?
